com.vector.cfg.automation.scripting.base

Class ScriptingException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.vector.cfg.automation.scripting.base.ScriptingException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDebugable, IExceptionAggregatesCauseChainInUserMessage, IUserMessage, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScriptExecutionException

    @PublishedApi(value=ADDITIONS_ALLOWED)
 @PublishedApiDomain(value=AUTOMATION_IF)
public abstract class ScriptingException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
implements IDebugable, IExceptionAggregatesCauseChainInUserMessage
    ScriptingException is the base type of all exceptions thrown by an IScriptTask execution. The IScriptTask.call(com.vector.cfg.util.servicecontext.IServiceContext, Object...) method will throw a subclass of ScriptingException to indicate failure of the execution.

    Every thrown exception from the script task client code is wrapped into an instance of ScriptingException, before handed to the caller.

    The exception provides information of the:

    • Where
    • Stackframe
    • What went wrong
    • Which script
    • What script file

    A client code should use subtypes of ScriptClientExecutionException to implement own exception types with the same behavior, instead of subclassing the class directly.

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        @PublishedMethod
protected boolean isKnownException(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Returns true, if the passed Throwable is of a known type, with a meaningful message. Then the message without the exception type is appended. Otherwise the exception type is also appended.
        Parameters:
        cause - the cause
        Returns:
        true, if is known exception

        @PublishedMethod
public java.lang.String toDebugString()

        NOTE: This method is created, because the Object.toString() method is used at several different locations. This method instead allows to create a debug string of the item for error logging or debugging.
